title: The CCNS Advanced Crit Racing Clinic
The CCAP Tuesday Night Criterium Series
West Rock Super Prestige Short Track Series
Rad & Gnar VISION QUEST -  Cycling for a Dream
The Seven Lakes Ride
description:
The Seven Lakes Ride is the brainchild of a Nerac Earth club member and Hartford Hospital radiation therapist, Pete LaValley. Over the past few years he watched the economic woes that we all face hit his patients particularly hard.  Volunteer numbers fell as gas prices rose, and in one instance, one of his patients was diagnosed with cancer, laid off from work, lost his medical benefits, lost his home and had to move in with an elderly parent and struggle to find money to buy food, gas and medications. This is just one of the many unfortunate stories that he would see and hear about in his daily work day. “I felt bad for these people who had worked their whole lives to become victim to a terrible disease thatconsumes their savings, quality of life and the golden years that we all hope for,” LaValley explained.

This is what inspired Pete to begin designing a charity cycling event that would raise money to help the patients where he works, Radiation Oncology at the John DeQuattro Cancer Center in Manchester, CT. The goal is to raise money through sponsorships, donations and participant registrations to help ease the stressful situation that these cancer patients face with making ends meet, so they can concentrate on beating their disease. Proceeds from The Seven Lakes Ride will help eligible patients by providing items such as medications, gas and grocery cards to help with transportation and grocery needs.
course:
The ride will begin and end at the Stafford High School in Stafford Springs, CT. There will be a 20, 25, 45 and a 62 mile route to choose from. The 62 mile ride travels through the charming rural towns of Willington, Ashford, Woodstock then heads into the quaint southeastern Massachusetts towns of Sturbridge, Holland, and Wales before returning to Union, Staffordville and Stafford. The 25 mile ride travel along the quiet country roads of Stafford, Staffordville, Union Ct. and Wales Ma. We are glad to offer a flatter 20 and 45 mile route again this year. These routes are designed to accommodate cyclists who found our 25 and 65 mile routes to challenging.

All routes are fully supported and there will be multiple rest stops stocked with food, drinks and water. After the ride, there will be a raffle for some great prizes. So come out and “Pedal for Patients” with us -- you don’t want to miss it!!
registration:
Registration opens at 7:00 am and closes at 9:30 am.

Start Times:

62 Miles 8:00 am
45 Miles 8:30 am
25 Miles 9:00 am
20 Miles 9:30 am

title: CCAP Summer MTB Camp
description: Overnight youth mountain bike camp offering a week long training camp designed specifically for the needs of junior cyclists.  Riders will be placed into two ability groups.
course: Varying courses of single track in surrounding Mansfield, CT area.
registration:
Register online:  https://www.bikereg.com/ccap-junior-summer-camp-mtb
$1150.00 with special pricing for CCAP Team members.
notes:
Any rider between the ages of 10-18 is welcome to join. Whether it's an enthusiastic junior cyclist looking to rub shoulders with experienced racers, or a young rider who's avid about his or her riding and is looking to be introduced to a broader world of cycling. All riding will be held on the beautiful cross-country trail systems surround UCONN.
Quiet, comfortable UCONN dorm room accommodations. Each camper will have one roommate.
All meals, both on and off the bike. Breakfast and dinner will be served by UCONN's premier dining services. Lunches will be served “on the trails” during training sessions or back at campus.
Daily laundry service.
Throughout camp, there will be a 1 to 4 coach to camper ratio. This way we can ensure personalized, one on one instruction and safe riding conditions each day.
directions:
University of Connecticut, Mansfield, CT  06269
From the West – Interstate 84 East to Exit 68. From exit, take a right onto Route 195, and follow for 7 miles to campus.

Alternate directions from the West – Interstate 84 East to Interstate 384 East. At end of Interstate 384 East, take left fork to Route 44 East. Follow Route 44 East to intersection with Route 195. Take a right onto Route 195 and follow the signs to campus.

From the East – Interstate 84 West to Exit 68. From exit, take a left onto Route 195, and follow for 7 miles to campus.

From the Southeast – Interstate 95 to 395 North. Take Exit 81 West to Route 32 North. Follow Route 32 North to Willimantic. In town, turn right and go over bridge. Continue straight through the light and follow 195 North for 8 miles to campus.

title: CCAP Summer Road Race Camp
description: The CCAP is excited to host its second annual overnight youth summer road cycling camp from 8/7 to 8/14 at the University of Connecticut in Mansfield, CT! Join the experienced CCAP coaching staff and fellow junior riders for a week long training camp designed specifically for the needs of junior cyclists. Camp riders will be placed into two ability based groups to ensure that each junior has a fun and amazing week of training, in a friendly and positive atmosphere.
course: Local paved roads surrounding UCONN Campus/Storrs CT
registration:
Register online:  https://www.bikereg.com/ccap-junior-summer-camp-road
$1150.00 with special pricing for CCAP Team members
notes:
Any rider between the ages of 10-18 is welcome to join. Whether it's an enthusiastic junior cyclist looking to rub shoulders with category 1 and 2 racers, or a young rider who's avid about his or her riding and is looking to be introduced to the world of competitive cycling. All practices and drills will be held on quiet, safe roads in southern Connecticut.
CCAP coaches have planned out a week of fun, positive, instructive riding, as well as beneficial "classroom" sessions to get all riders ready to take their own riding to the next level.
Priority number one is to make sure all participants have a great time!
Quiet, comfortable UCONN dorm room accommodations. Each camper will have one roommate.
All meals, both on and off the bike. Breakfast and dinner will be served by UCONN's premier dining services. Lunches will be served “on the trails” during training sessions or back at campus
Daily laundry service.
Throughout camp, there will be a 1 to 4 coach to camper ratio. This way we can ensure personalized, one on one instruction and safe riding conditions each day.
directions:
University of Connecticut, Mansfield, CT  06269
From the West – Interstate 84 East to Exit 68. From exit, take a right onto Route 195, and follow for 7 miles to campus.

Alternate directions from the West – Interstate 84 East to Interstate 384 East. At end of Interstate 384 East, take left fork to Route 44 East. Follow Route 44 East to intersection with Route 195. Take a right onto Route 195 and follow the signs to campus.

From the East – Interstate 84 West to Exit 68. From exit, take a left onto Route 195, and follow for 7 miles to campus.

From the Southeast – Interstate 95 to 395 North. Take Exit 81 West to Route 32 North. Follow Route 32 North to Willimantic. In town, turn right and go over bridge. Continue straight through the light and follow 195 North for 8 miles to campus.

title: "The Cream Will Rise" Road Race
description: “The Cream Will Rise” Bicycle Circuit Race is USA Cycling sanctioned racing event, located in Ledyard, CT taking place Sunday, August 7th 2016, from 8:00am through 4:00pm. Featuring 522 ft of climbing per lap with a max grade of 15.7%, racers will be treated to smooth pavement and beautiful eastern CT roads, in addition to strong competition from their fellow racers.
course: The course starts at the Gallup Hill School, and heads northwest, descending down Town Farm Rd and turning right onto Shewville Rd. After traveling down Shewville Rd, a flat to rolling affair, riders then turn left onto Gallup Hill Rd, where the bulk of the climbing is, before turning right back onto Town Farm Rd.
registration: Registration opens at 7:00 am and closes 30 minutes before each race. Day of registration has a $15 fee. Registration is located at Gallup Hill School, 169 Gallup Hill Rd, Ledyard, CT.
directions:

title: Silk City Cyclocross
description: The 6th annual Silk City Cyclocross is the first stop of the Connecticut Series of CX. The race will be held on the WEST CAMPUS again this year. Expect a similar course to years past, except even better.
course: A great combination of fast, power and technical.  Bring your cross skills, this is not just a pedaling course.
registration: USA Cycling license required. One-day licenses can be purchased at registration for $10. : A one-day license can not be used in the Mens or Womens Pro/1/2/3 races. Day-of registration will be available from 7:30 a.m. until 1/2 hour before scheduled start time for all fields. A $10 day of registration fee will apply (except juniors). Additional races only $10. Promoter reserves the right to cancel or combine fields with less than 10 pre-registered riders. fields that pay 5 places must have a minimum of 20 riders. Less than 20 will pay 3 places. Juniors race for FREE: we'll even pay all the fees including the one-day license if you need one. You don't have to race a junior field to qualify. Pre-register here if you want to race another category field and we'll comp you at registration. Sorry Kids, only one free race. All national cyclocross champions - Free entry: limited to the field that you are the champion of and you must wear your championship jersey in that race. Second race at at the reduced second race rate. Pre-register and you will be comp'd at registration. All USA Cycling rules apply. Mountain bikes without bar ends are acceptable. Helmets are required at all times. Jerseys must have sleeves (no tank tops or vests (unless they're leather). All CT Series of CX rules apply. *cash prize not to exceed $1999 per category*
notes: Centrally located minutes east of Hartford, Ct. 1.5 hours from Boston, 2 hours from New York City, 2 hours from Albany.
directions:
Exit 1 off I-384. Follow signs to Manchester Community College. 

PLEASE NOTE!!!
Enter college on Hillstown Road. Parking is in the WEST LOT!
DON'T park in the East Lot please.

title: Veterans Memorial CX Race p/b Team ERRACE>ORG
Ashford Metric Century+
description: This is a fund raising event to benefit the Ashford Recreation Department and Nerac Earth Cycling Club. All routes are fully supported and include the quiet and rolling hills of Ashford, Eastford and Woodstock.  Come out and enjoy the stunning fall foliage in classic New England.
course: There will be one rest stop on the 25 mile ride and several rest stops on the 62 mile and 100 mile ride.  Rest stops will be stocked with snacks (gatorade, water, pbj's, baked goods, granola bars, m&m's, etc.) and will have a floor pump and basic repair tools.
registration: Registration starts at 7:00am and ends at 9:30am.  100 miler's should be on the road by 7:30am, 62 milers by 9am and all other riders should be on the road by 9:45am.  Day of ride registration will be an additional $10 for each ride except the 10 miler which will be an additional $5, so $20 for the 10 miler, $30 for the 25 miler, $35 for the 62 miler, and $45 for the 100 miler on the day of the event.  Please register online to save money!
directions:
Ride starts at Ashford Elementary School on Route 89 in Ashford, CT

Ashford Elementary School
440 Westford Rd.
Ashford, CT 06278

From the South and Willimantic:
From Willimantic take Route 195 north toward The University of Connecticut. In Mansfield Center turn right onto Route 89. Follow Route 89 north into Ashford. Cross Route 44. Ashford School is located on Route 89 2 miles north of the intersection with Route 44.

From the West and Hartford:
Take I-84 East to Exit 69. Turn right onto Route 74. Follow Route 74 through Willington to Route 44 in Ashford. Turn left on Route 44 to the intersection of Route 89. Turn left on Route 89. The school is on the right 2 miles to the north.

From the North and Massachusetts:
Take I-84 to Exit 72. Turn left on Route 89. Follow Route 89 (south) watching the signs because it turns twice. Ashford School is located on the left side of Route 89 about 6 miles from I-84.

From the East and Rhode Island:
From the Rhode Island border take Route 101 west. It merges with Route 44 in Pomfret. Continue on Route 44 west until Route 89 in Ashford. Turn right on Route 89. Ashford school is located on the right about 2 miles north of Route 44.
